lv.emes.libraries.tools.platform

Interface IKeyStrokeExecutor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MS_KeyStrokeExecutor

    public interface IKeyStrokeExecutor
    An interface that describes actions to be done to imitate keyboard button pressing or mouse controlling.

    Public methods: -keyDown -keyUp -keyPress -isKeyDown -isCapsLockToggled -getCurrentMouseCoords -mouseLeftDown -mouseLeftUp -mouseLeftClick -mouseRightDown -mouseRightUp -mouseRightClick -mouseSetCoords -mouseMove -mouseWheel

    Version:
    1.0.
    Author:
    eMeS

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Point getCurrentMouseCoords() 
      boolean isCapsLockToggled()
      Tests, if Caps Lock key is toggled.
      boolean isKeyDown(java.lang.String key)
      Tests, if key of keyboard is pressed.
      void keyDown(java.lang.String key)
      Imitates keyboard key pressing down and hold it.
      void keyPress(java.lang.String key)
      Imitates keyboard key hitting (pressing down and releasing it immediately).
      void keyUp(java.lang.String key)
      Imitates keyboard key releasing.
      void mouseLeftClick()
      Do mouse left click and release it immediately.
      void mouseLeftDown()
      Do mouse left click and hold it.
      void mouseLeftUp()
      Release mouse left click.
      void mouseMove(java.awt.Point coords)
      Moves mouse for specified distance.
      void mouseRightClick()
      Do mouse right click and release it immediately.
      void mouseRightDown()
      Do mouse right click and hold it.
      void mouseRightUp()
      Release mouse right click.
      void mouseSetCoords(java.awt.Point coords)
      Sets mouse pointer to a specific coordinates on the screen (be aware of user's screen resolution!).
      void mouseWheel(int steps)
      Rotates mouse wheel up or down for count of steps.

    • Method Detail

      • keyDown

        void keyDown(java.lang.String key)
        Imitates keyboard key pressing down and hold it.
        Parameters:
        key - code of valid keyboard key.

      • keyUp

        void keyUp(java.lang.String key)
        Imitates keyboard key releasing.
        Parameters:
        key - code of valid keyboard key.

      • keyPress

        void keyPress(java.lang.String key)
        Imitates keyboard key hitting (pressing down and releasing it immediately).
        Parameters:
        key - code of valid keyboard key.

      • isKeyDown

        boolean isKeyDown(java.lang.String key)
        Tests, if key of keyboard is pressed.
        Parameters:
        key - code of valid keyboard key.

      • isCapsLockToggled

        boolean isCapsLockToggled()
        Tests, if Caps Lock key is toggled.
        Returns:
        true if caps lock on.

      • getCurrentMouseCoords

        java.awt.Point getCurrentMouseCoords()
        Returns:
        mouse pointer coordinates in current position.

        Do mouse left click and hold it.

        void mouseRightUp()
        Release mouse right click.

      • mouseRightClick

        void mouseRightClick()
        Do mouse right click and release it immediately.

      • mouseSetCoords

        void mouseSetCoords(java.awt.Point coords)
        Sets mouse pointer to a specific coordinates on the screen (be aware of user's screen resolution!).
        Parameters:
        coords - X starting from screen's left edge with value 0; Y starting from screen's top edge with value 0.

      • mouseMove

        void mouseMove(java.awt.Point coords)
        Moves mouse for specified distance. Simply moves mouse pointer for (X, Y) pixels.
        Parameters:
        coords - X starting from screen's left edge with value 0; Y starting from screen's top edge with value 0.

      • mouseWheel

        void mouseWheel(int steps)
        Rotates mouse wheel up or down for count of steps.
        Parameters:
        steps - wheel up if given value is negative and down, if value is positive.
